page.title: 13GOVERNMENT_BUILDINGS_
page.content: In 1961 Stanley Civic Hall was opened by Joseph.P.Charlton.Inside the Civic Hall are four studios.In all studios films are shown,pantomimes, rehersals and dancing classes are held.Separate functions are held upstairs,such as parties,weddings and discos.There is also a bar which is well frequented. Viewers dropped by approxumately 50 people per night when the video recorders were brought out.However all new films are not available in video shops and between 500 and 600 people per night have been known to attend the Civic Hall to see films not released on video tape.Four years later on the 21st of August 1965 the Stanley Swimming and Turkish baths was opened by Councillor Jolly.The baths have one large swimming pool,one small swimming pool,a low diving board and high board.
